IntentFilterProxy * mpProxy

Detailed Description

Structured description of Demand values to be matched.

For information about how to create and resolve DemandFilter, please refer to Subscriber.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::core::DemandFilter::DemandFilter ( )

Create an empty DemandFilter.

gaia::core::DemandFilter::DemandFilter ( const gaia::base::String &  action) [explicit]

Create a DemandFilter that matches a single action with no data.

If no data characteristics are subsequently specified, then the filter will only match Demands that contain no data.

gaia::core::DemandFilter::DemandFilter ( const gaia::base::String &  action,
const gaia::base::String &  dataType 
)

Create a DemandFilter that matches a single action and data type.

Note: MIME type matching is case-sensitive. You should always write your MIME types with lower case letters, and any MIME types you receive from outside should be converted to lower case before supplying them here.

gaia::core::DemandFilter::DemandFilter ( const DemandFilter &  o)

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addAction ( const gaia::base::String &  action)

Add a new Demand action to match against.

If any actions are included in the filter, then an Demand's action must be one of those values for it to match. If no actions are included, the Demand action is ignored.

Parameters:
actionName of the action to match, i.e. Demand::ACTION_VIEW().
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addCategory ( const gaia::base::String &  category)

Add a new Demand category to match against.

The semantics of categories is the opposite of actions -- an Demand includes the categories that it requires, all of which must be included in the filter in order to match. In other words, adding a category to the filter has no impact on matching unless that category is specified in the intent.

Parameters:
categoryName of category to match, i.e. Demand::CATEGORY_LAUNCHER().
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addDataAuthority ( const gaia::base::String &  host)

Add a new Demand data authority to match against.

The filter must include one or more schemes (via addDataScheme(String)) for the authority to be considered. If any authorities are included in the filter, then a Demand's data must match one of them. If no authorities are included, then only the scheme must match. Note: Host name is case-sensitive. You should always write your host names with lower case letters, and any host names you receive from outside should be converted to lower case before supplying them here.

Parameters:
hostThe host part of the authority to match. May start with a single '*' to wildcard the front of the host name.
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addDataAuthority ( const gaia::base::String &  host,
const gaia::base::String &  port 
)

Add a new Demand data authority to match against.

The filter must include one or more schemes (via addDataScheme(String)) for the authority to be considered. If any authorities are included in the filter, then a Demand's data must match one of them. If no authorities are included, then only the scheme must match. Note: Host name is case-sensitive. You should always write your host names with lower case letters, and any host names you receive from outside should be converted to lower case before supplying them here.

Parameters:
hostThe host part of the authority to match. May start with a single '*' to wildcard the front of the host name.
portPort part of the authority to match.
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addDataPath ( const gaia::base::String &  path,
int32_t  type 
)

Add a new Demand data path to match against.

The filter must include one or more schemes (via addDataScheme(String)) and one or more authorities (via addDataAuthority(String, String)) for the path to be considered. If any paths are included in the filter, then a Demand's data must match one of them. If no paths are included, then only the scheme/authority must match. The path given here can either be a literal that must directly match or match against a prefix, or it can be a simple globbing pattern. If the latter, you can use '*' anywhere in the pattern to match zero or more instances of the previous character, '.' as a wildcard to match any character, and '\' to escape the next character.

Parameters:
pathEither a raw string that must exactly match the file path, or a simple pattern, depending on type.
typeDetermines how path will be compared to determine a match: either PatternMatcher#PATTERN_LITERAL, PatternMatcher#PATTERN_PREFIX, or PatternMatcher#PATTERN_SIMPLE_GLOB.
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addDataScheme ( const gaia::base::String &  scheme)

Add a new Demand data scheme to match against.

If any schemes are included in the filter, then a Demand's data must be either one of these schemes or a matching data type. If no schemes are included, then an Intent will match only if it includes no data. Note: scheme matching is case-sensitive. You should always write your schemes with lower case letters, and any schemes you receive from outside should be converted to lower case before supplying them here.

Parameters:
schemeName of the scheme to match, i.e. "http".
void gaia::core::DemandFilter::addDataType ( const gaia::base::String &  type)

Add a new Demand data type to match against.

If any types are included in the filter, then an Intent's data must be either one of these types or a matching scheme. If no data types are included, then a Demand will only match if it specifies no data. Note: MIME type matching is case-sensitive. You should always write your MIME types with lower case letters, and any MIME types you receive from outside should be converted to lower case before supplying them here.

Parameters:
typeName of the data type to match

bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasAction ( const gaia::base::String &  action) const

Is the given action included in the filter?

Parameters:
actionThe action to look for.
Returns:
True if the action is explicitly mentioned in the filter.
bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasCategory ( const gaia::base::String &  category) const

Is the given category included in the filter?

Parameters:
categoryThe category that the filter supports.
Returns:
True if the category is explicitly mentioned in the filter.
bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasDataAuthority ( const gaia::net::Uri &  data) const

Is the given data authority included in the filter? Note that if the filter does not include any authorities, false will always be returned.

Parameters:
dataThe data whose authority is being looked for.
Returns:
True if the data string matches an authority listed in the filter.
bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasDataPath ( const gaia::base::String &  data) const

Is the given data path included in the filter? Note that if the filter does not include any paths, false will always be returned.

Parameters:
dataThe data path to look for. This is without the scheme prefix.
Returns:
True if the data string matches a path listed in the filter.
bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasDataScheme ( const gaia::base::String &  scheme) const

Is the given data scheme included in the filter? Note that if the filter does not include any scheme, false will always be returned.

Parameters:
schemeThe data scheme to look for.
Returns:
True if the scheme is explicitly mentioned in the filter.
bool gaia::core::DemandFilter::hasDataType ( const gaia::base::String &  type) const

Is the given data type included in the filter? Note that if the filter does not include any type, false will always be returned.

Parameters:
typeThe data type to look for.
Returns:
True if the type is explicitly mentioned in the filter.
